Custom Taxonomy Support is only availabl: Custom Taxonomy Support is only available for licensed %1$s %2$s users.
%1$s %2$s lets you set the SEO title and: %1$s %2$s lets you set the SEO title and description for custom taxonomies. You can also control all of the robots meta and other options just like the default category and tags taxonomies.
Upgrade to Pro and Unlock Custom Taxonom: Upgrade to Pro and Unlock Custom Taxonomies
Press enter to create a keyword: Press enter to create a keyword
Go to %1$sLocal SEO Settings%2$s and set: Go to %1$sLocal SEO Settings%2$s and set up your local business info like location address, opening hours (%3$s), and Google Maps settings (%4$s).
Google, Bing and other search engines us: Google, Bing and other search engines use specific data from your schema markup to output data in their Knowledge Panels. This data is known as the Knowledge Graph. Use these settings to change how that data looks.
The home page settings below have been d: The home page settings below have been disabled because you are using a static home page. You can %1$sedit your home page settings%2$s directly to change the title and description.
Click on the tags below to insert variab: Click on the tags below to insert variables into your meta description.
Click on the tags below to insert variables into your site title.
A Description tag is required in order t: A Description tag is required in order to properly display your meta descriptions on your site.
Choose whether %1$s should output the re: Choose whether %1$s should output the required schema markup that Google needs to generate a sitelinks search box.

Minimum size: 112px x 112px, The image m: Minimum size: 112px x 112px, The image must be in JPG, PNG, GIF, SVG, or WEBP format.
Paste your image URL or select a new ima: Paste your image URL or select a new image
Select which team or department the phon: Select which team or department the phone number belongs to.
Name: Name
Choose whether the site represents a per: Choose whether the site represents a person or an organization.
This string gets appended to the titles: This string gets appended to the titles and descriptions of paginated pages (like term or archive pages).
Check this if you want your keywords on: Check this if you want your keywords on your Posts page (set in WordPress under Settings, Reading, Front Page Displays) and your archive pages to be dynamically generated from the keywords of the posts showing on that page. If unchecked, it will use the keywords set in the edit page screen for the posts page.
Check this if you want your tags for a g: Check this if you want your tags for a given post used as the Meta Keywords for this post (in addition to any keywords you specify on the Edit Post screen).
Check this if you want your categories f: Check this if you want your categories for a given post used as the Meta Keywords for this post (in addition to any keywords you specify on the Edit Post screen).
This option allows you to toggle the use: This option allows you to toggle the use of Meta Keywords throughout the whole of the site.
